TopicTitle: land on the oceans world...oh! i mean laythe.

Articles.Content:
Hi! im relativity new to KSP and just made my first land and return mission to the mun. but there is one target i set my eyes on as soon as i...saw it. here is my challenge. to create a rocket to go to laythe. there is two sub missions.

1: make it to laythe, take a screen shot of the surface, and return safely.

OR!

2: land on laythe and you dont have to return home. but you must have at least 6 kerbals in the shot and one rocket that will serve as the 'base'.

i will try this myself if i can get things working properly but my computer tends to lag during the initial takeoff up to stage separation. makeing it hard to do gravity turns. but i will get there. my question is...who is gonna enter my space race:)

Consider me interested. Laythe is one of my first targets for interplanetary travel, but first I've got to do some certification runs to the Mun and back: Haven't quite got used to .17 yet. Might attempt to bring a spaceplane down onto Laythe, as well. Stay tuned!

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VR6D_kDx1hk&feature=plcp

Somewhere in that video of mine I got some pics of Laythe. Still working on an idea on how to "land" on it, but the idea I keep hearing is a spaceplane.
